data.rationale:
Algorithm::Diff is a prerequisite. VCS::Lite is an OO wrapper, and
    provides more functionality.

    Whereas VCS provides an interface to a pre-installed version
    control system, and VCS::SaVeS provides a simple VCS in perl,
    VCS::Lite is a tool kit to do the functions that one normally needs
    a VCS for.

    I thought about Text::Merge as a possibility, but finding the VCS
    namespace seemed more appropriate.
